peril.views.slick.util

Class Font

  • java.lang.Object
    • peril.views.slick.util.Font

  • public final class Font
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates the behaviours of a font that can be used to display text on screen. This font must be initialised using init().
    Since:
    2018-02-16
    Version:
    1.01.01
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    Color, UnicodeFont, Graphics

      • draw

        public void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                 java.lang.String text,
                 float x,
                 float y)
        Draws the text in the Font on the Graphics and then reverts back.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics of the screen.
        text - The text to be written.
        x - The x coordinate of the text on the screen.
        y - The y coordinate of the text on the screen.

        public int getWidth(java.lang.String text)
        Retrieves the int width of a specified string.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Retrieves the line height of the '|' in this Font. For a more accurate height use getHeight(String).
        Returns:
        The height of the text.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight(java.lang.String text)
        Retrieves the line height of this Font for a specified string.
        Parameters:
        text - The text that will be displayed in this Font.
        Returns:
        The height of the text.
